oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Crayon portrait of Union soldier from Dyer County, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Framed crayon portrait of a soldier wearing the uniform of the 14th Tenn. Cav. Regt., USA. Also called Bradford's Battalion, it was virtually annihilated at Ft. Pillow, Tenn., in April 1864. Confederate forces under the command of Maj. Gen. Nathan Bedford Forrest overran the garrison and massacred hundreds of black soldiers after they surrendered.
